name: Sabo, Appellant, v. Monongahela Railway Company, Appellant

judges: Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and Eagen, JJ.
parties: Sabo, Appellant, v. Monongahela Railway Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The order awarding a new trial, which is the subject of the plaintiff’s appeal at No. 112, is affirmed. The defendant’s appeal at No. 148 from the order denying its motion for judgment n.o.v. is dismissed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Albert D. Brandon, with him Thomas Parle Shearer, and Brandon <& Shearer, for plaintiff.
John David Rhodes, with him Pringle, Bredin & Martin, for defendant.
casebody.head_matter:
Sabo, Appellant, v. Monongahela Railway Company, Appellant.
Argued April 28, 1961.
Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and Eagen, JJ.
Albert D. Brandon, with him Thomas Parle Shearer, and Brandon <& Shearer, for plaintiff.
John David Rhodes, with him Pringle, Bredin & Martin, for defendant.
May 22, 1961:
